abstract: Under Jeffrey Immelt, General Electric has changed its tune on several things, like cleaning up a massive pollution site along the Hudson River. But is the massive conglomerate — which makes jet engines, loans and the TV show “Heroes” — ready to break itself up in order to save, well, itself?
lead_paragraph: Under Jeffrey Immelt, General Electric has changed its tune on several things, like cleaning up a massive pollution site along the Hudson River. But is the massive conglomerate — which makes jet engines, loans and the TV show “Heroes” — ready to break itself up in order to save, well, itself?

headline.main: Is G.E. Too Big for Its Own Good?
